qas.question: When were the first telephone lines installed?
When did electric street lights replace the gas operated lights?
When did the Hipodromo de Maronas start operating?
When was the Central Railway Station of Montevideo inaugurated?

context: The first telephone lines were installed in <a0_0>1882<a0_0/> and electric street lights took the place of the gas operated ones in <a1_0>1886<a1_0/>. The Hipódromo de Maroñas started operating in <a2_0>1888<a2_0/>, and the neighbourhoods of Reus del Sur, Reus del Norte and Conciliación were inaugurated in 1889. The new building of the School of Arts and Trades, as well as Zabala Square in Ciudad Vieja were inaugurated in 1890, followed by the Italian Hospital in 1891. In the same year, the village of Peñarol was founded. Other neighbourhoods that were founded were Belgrano and Belvedere in 1892, Jacinto Vera in 1895 and Trouville in 1897. In 1894 the new port was constructed, and in <a3_0>1897<a3_0/>, the Central Railway Station of Montevideo was inaugurated.
